Weapons

Weapons in Remixed Dungeon are equipment items used to attack enemies. They come in various types and tiers, each with different properties and special abilities.

Weapon Categories

  • Melee Weapons: Used in close combat
    • Short Sword - Basic sword
    • Dart - Thrown weapon
    • Boomerang - Returning thrown weapon
    • Bone Saw - Doctor's special weapon
  • Ranged Weapons:
    • Wooden Bow - Basic ranged weapon
    • Elven Bow - Elf's specialty weapon
    • Chaos Bow - Powerful chaos weapon
  • Throwing Weapons: Throwing Weapons
    • Throwing Stone - Basic thrown stone
    • Tomahawk - Throwing axe
    • Gnoll Tamahawk - Gnoll hero class's special throwing axe (Gnoll's starting weapon)

Weapon Properties

  • Damage: Physical damage dealt per hit
  • Durability: How many hits the weapon can take before breaking
  • Speed: Attack speed modifier
  • Accuracy: Hit chance bonus
  • STR: Strength requirement to wield effectively
  • Tier: Quality level (1-5 for regular weapons, 6 for special weapons)

Special Mechanics

  • Enchantments: Weapons can have special magical properties added via Scroll of Weapon Upgrade
  • Upgrading: Weapons can be upgraded with Scrolls of Upgrade
  • Class Bonuses: Some classes get bonuses with specific weapon types

Weapon Tiers

  • Tier 1: Dart, Throwing Stone
  • Tier 2: Short Sword, Hand Axe
  • Tier 3: Spear, Quarterstaff
  • Tier 4: Sword, Mace
  • Tier 5: Long Sword, Battle Axe
  • Tier 6: Special weapons like Chaos Sword

Code Reference

  • Short Sword - Basic melee weapon
  • Dart - Basic throwing weapon
  • Boomerang - Returning throwing weapon
  • Bone Saw - Special weapon for Doctor class
  • Wooden Bow - Basic ranged weapon
  • Elven Bow - Elf's starting weapon
  • Chaos Bow - Special chaotic weapon
  • Tamahawk - Throwing axe (in code)
  • Gnoll Tamahawk - Gnoll's special throwing axe

Strategy

  • Choose weapons that complement your class and playstyle
  • Consider the trade-offs between damage, speed, and durability
  • Upgrade weapons when you have the resources and opportunity
  • Consider enchantments that complement your build

See Also

  • Armor - Protective equipment
  • Enchantments - Magical properties for weapons
  • Combat - General combat mechanics
  • Playable Classes - Class-specific weapon preferences
